title: Morbidly obese man, 44, 'who described himself as a "big cuddly bear" raped woman he met on Match'
text:
Christopher Schubert denies two counts of rape and two counts of sexual assault

A morbidly obese rapist forced himself on a woman in her own home when she rejected his advances because he was so much fatter than the photos on his dating profile implied, a court heard.

On Match.com Christopher Schubert, 44, described himself a a 'big cuddly bear looking for his mate' and exchanged messages with a woman in January 2018 before the pair agreed to meet at her home.

But when he arrived she thought: 'S***, you're huge', Oxford Crown Court heard she told police.

The next morning, following his departure in the early hours, the alleged victim reported to police that Schubert sexually assaulted and raped her after she invited him in for a cup of tea.

A medical examination on the woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, showed 'lacerations and abrasions' which were consistent with 'rough' sex, the jury heard.

On January 30, 2018, following an exchange of messages on Match.com, Schubert arrived at the home of the complainant, a separated mother, in Oxfordshire.

She told officers: 'When he arrived, obviously I knew straight away that he didn't look like he did in his profile picture.

'To be honest with you, I thought: "S***, you're huge. You're absolutely huge".

'I had already said we were not going to have sex. You end up getting to know someone over a cup of tea and I invited him in to be sociable.

'I thought he was going to have a cup of tea and chat.'

Prior to Schubert's arrival, the woman told police, they had discussed sleeping in the same bed if he came over to her house but she had said nothing would happen and that she would wear her pyjamas.

The woman told police she invited Schubert, pictured, in just for a cup of tea after he arrived at her doorstep looking very dissimilar from - and much larger than - his dating profiles pictures

The woman added: 'Given his size, we would not have fitted comfortably in the same bed.

'There is personal space and there is personal space. Even if I had a king size bed...I'd have no personal space at all. I'd have nowhere to go.

'There had already been a conversation. He had invited me over to his and he had a king size bed.

'I said to him that if I felt comfortable I'd sleep in a king size bed, but I'd have my personal space.

'When he arrived and I saw his size I just thought: "There is absolutely no way".

'I said I did not know he was as big as what he was. Literally.

'It doesn't stop me liking someone because of his size but it was never my intention to sleep with him.'

Today Schubert, of St Neots, Cambs, denied two counts of rape and two counts of sexual assault by penetration.

He sat wearing a dark blazer and t-shirt as he listened to the chat history between him and the complainant being read out before the jury and Judge Nigel Daly.

He had told his alleged victim how he earned a living selling 'designer clothes, shoes, anything I can get my hands on' over online auctioneering marketplace, eBay.

During police interview, jurors were told, Schubert claimed the sex was consensual.

Oxford Crown Court heard that the ordeal caused 'excruciating' pain for the woman and that the sex was not consensual.

Charles Ward-Jackson, prosecuting, said: 'This is a case about a woman who was raped and sexually assaulted in her own home.

'By a man she had just met on an internet dating site, that man being Schubert.'

The trial continues.
description: Christopher Schubert, 44, met his alleged victim in January 2018 on Match.com. They arranged to meet at her Oxfordshire home where she alleges he raped her after she rejected him for being fat.
